title: Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site: Things To Do
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do             Things To Do         Walking the Santa Fe Trail during a special event. NPS Photo       Activities A 1/4 mile walk down the trail will bring you to the gate of the fort. Inside you can view the 20 minute documentary film, "Traders, Tribes and Travelers". Self-guided tours and the film are available throughout the year. Living history interpreters provide guided tours and demonstrations June 1 through September 1. Guided tours are available September through May at 10:30 am and 1:00 pm. Summer tours are at 9:30 am, 11:00 am, 1:00 pm, and 2:30 pm. Guided tours are not available during special events. Organized group tours can be reserved by calling (719) 383-5026.        2016 Special Events The fort will come to life during the Santa Fe Trail, Kid's Quarters, Old Fashioned Fourth of July, Histpance Heritage Day and the Traditional Holiday Celebration.  Click here for the calendar of events.           Hiking trail NPS  Bent's Old Fort Hiking Trail  Visitors can hike a mile and a half trail that winds its way through the cottonwood trees alongside the Arkansas River. The marsh is home to several species of birds. Interpretive exhibit signs tell the story of the river ecosystem, Santa Fe Trail and Bent's Fort. Click here for a bird list.
